required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Temporary Filling Material Composition on the Success Rate of Endodontic Treatments
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Temporary Filling Material Composition on the Success Rate of Endodontic Treatments - Randomized Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is through a randomized clinical trial, double blind, splitmouth, evaluate the success rate (contamination rate, periapical lesion relapse and the presence of exudate between the treatment's sessions) of endodontically treated teeth that required filling with temporary material. The composition of the temporary filling material (cement (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate) will be evaluated. Data will be collected, tabulated and submitted to statistical analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: The need for endodontic treatment is still very common in the clinical routine, whether due to dento-alveolar trauma or caries. In some cases, the temporary filling procedure is required until the endodontic treatment is completed. The temporary filling material should be biocompatible and bacteriostatic. The aim of this study is through a randomized clinical trial, double blind, split-mouth, evaluate the success rate (contamination rate, periapical lesion relapse and the presence of exudate between the treatment's sessions) of endodontically treated teeth that required filling with temporary material. The composition of the temporary filling material (cement (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate) will be evaluated. Twenty participants with at least two teeth with the need of endodontic treatment will be selected. The teeth will be randomly divided into 2 different groups according to the temporary filling material composition (Based on calcium hydroxide; and based on mineral trioxide aggregate). Data will be collected, tabulated and submitted to statistical analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Contamination rate of endodontically treated teeth that required filling with temporary material with a 1 year follow up.
Periapical lesion relapse of endodontically treated teeth that required filling with temporary material with a 1 year follow up.
Presence of exudate between the treatment's sessions of endodontically treated teeth that required filling with temporary material with a 1 year follow up.

intervention.description: Carie removal with a low speed handpiece

intervention.intervention_name: Manipulation of the temporary filling material based on Calcium Hydroxide
intervention.description: Manipulation of the temporary material based on Calcium Hydroxide according to the manufacturer's recommendations.

intervention.intervention_name: Manipulation of the temporary filling material based on Mineral trioxide aggregate
intervention.description: Manipulation of the temporary material based on Mineral trioxide aggregate according to the manufacturer's recommendations.

intervention.intervention_name: Material insertion on the root canal
intervention.description: Material insertion on the root canal according to the manufacturer's recommendations

intervention.intervention_name: Material re-insertion on the root canal accordging to the infection needs.
intervention.description: Material re-insertion on the root canal according to the manufacturer's recommendations
Definiteve canal root obturation with gutta-percha and definitive cement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers
- Both genres
- Presence of at least two teeth with indication of endodontic treatment
- Good oral hygiene
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dentures or orthodontics
- Presence of periodontal disease
- Presence of parafunctional habits
- Presence of systemic disease
- Presence of severe psychological disturbe;
- Constant use of analgesic and, or anti-inflammatory
- Allergic response to dental products
